```rust
/**  - Outer block doc (exactly) 2 asterisks */
```

which we could tag as well

discussion_comments.comment_body:
I suggest having the first line also capture the uncomment-an-existing-comment behavior:
```
Pressing Ctrl-c toggles commenting for the line under your cursor.
```

If you want to add more detail:
```
If the line is a comment, Ctrl-c will uncomment. If the line is not a comment, Ctrl-C will make it a comment.
The appropriate comment sequence (e.g. //, #, --, ...) will be selected for the language of the file.
```

discussion_comments.comment_body:
Actually, re-reading your proposed change with the two-line context, I think the current formulation is more appropriate for a beginner-focused tutorial:

```
 Pressing Ctrl-c comments the line under your cursor.
 To uncomment the line, press Ctrl-c again.
```

I don't think either shortening these two lines to one, nor replacing them with more detailed instructions, would be desirable changes considering the audience of this tutorial, for whom we want to minimize cognitive friction as much as possible.
